title: How Many Calories Are in 5 Strawberries?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in 5 strawberries, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, fat, and quick tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories Are in 5 Strawberries?
assumptions: Fresh, medium-sized strawberries (~12 g each), whole, washed, no added sugar or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by size, ripeness, variety, and growing conditions. Check labels for packaged berries when available.

quick_answer.text: Five medium strawberries offer about 20 kcal, 1 g fiber, and 4 g carbs mostly from natural sugars.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Dipped in 1 tsp chocolate per strawberry
With 1 tsp sugar sprinkled per strawberry
Blended into a smoothie (no added ingredients)

faqs.q: How many calories in one strawberry?
faqs.a: About 4 kcal for one medium fresh strawberry.
Yes, 5 strawberries have ~4.5 g carbs, with 1 g fiber and 3 g natural sugars.

faqs.q: Do strawberries have any protein or fat?
faqs.a: Minimal—0.5 g protein and 0.2 g fat total for 5 strawberries.

faqs.q: How does strawberry size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger strawberries (~18 g) may have 6 kcal each; smaller (~8 g) around 3 kcal. Adjust based on weight.

faqs.q: Are frozen strawberries higher in calories?
faqs.a: No, similar if unsweetened—freezing doesn't add calories, but check for added sugars in packs.
